SALT LEVEL Salt Level %1$s%% CURRENT Low Salt Levels SALT TYPE Order More What type of salt should I use? Recommended salt types are nugget, pellet, or coarse solar salts with less than 1% impurities. If your water softener has run out of softening capacity and needs a immediate recharge, you can press the "'"recharge now"'" button to begin this immediately. This is not necessary under normal working conditions. What time would you like your water softener to automatically recharge? The device will only recharge when it needs to, so this likely occurs periodically and not every day. The recharge is required to restore your water softener"'"s capacity to produce soft water. This should ideally be done at a time when you"'"re not likely to be using any water. ARE YOU SURE? While your water softener is recharging you still have water in your home, but it maybe hard water until the unit has finished regenerating. The charge will take approximately two hours. CONTINUE CANCEL ALREADY RECHARGING Check your water softener detail page to see how much time is left remaining until the recharge is complete.
Your water hardness level is defaulted to <device default value> gpg (grains per gallon). This should vary by location and water source. To edit water hardness, please refer to the owner"'"s manual and update the setting on the device itself. To determine your water hardness level, you can call your municipality if you use city water or purchase a water test kit.

ODD DAYS Water on odd numbered dates. EVEN DAYS Water on even numbered dates. MANUAL MODE STOP WATERING You are watering on a schedule. Do you want to stop watering the current zone only, or all zones in this event? ALL ZONES CURRENT ZONE ONLY Choose Manual when you do not want to follow a schedule. Save water and money by reducing your watering time by a percentage for the entire schedule.\n\ne.g. If every event in the schedule is set to 10 min/zone during the summer, you may want to set Water Saver to 50% in the fall, which will reduce watering to 5 min/zone. ADD A PERSON What type of access do you want\nthis person to have? FULL ACCESS FULL ACCESS (EMAIL REQUIRED) This person will have login access to your Place and will be able to view your Dashboard, Scenes, Rules, Devices, Schedules, People, History, and have limited access to your settings. They will never see your billing information.\n\nCommonly assigned to a spouse/partner or roommate. Ideal for anyone living at this Place. \nFull access is commonly assigned to\na spouse/partner or roommate.\n\nFull access grants this person the\nsame access as the account owner. PARTIAL ACCESS Great for anyone you want to let into your home or to receieve Rule Notifications without providing them a login or digital access to your Place. Perfect for children or individuals who do not have smartphones. \nIdeal for family, close friends, children, and service professionals. How do you know this person? Welcome to Arcus Favorites Cards Customize the Dashboard Expand Your Smart Home Manage Your Smart Home Tutorials The Dashboard is a summary of what\'s\ngoing on in your home right now. Save your most used Devices and Scenes\nin Favorites for quick access. Cards help organize your devices.\nTap each Card and explore the\nspecific features of each one. Tap on the settings icon to hide and\nre-order the cards, edit your Favorites bar,\nand personalize your experience. Tap the \'+\' to add Devices, Scenes, Rules and\nmore to your smart home. Tap here to explore and edit everything\nyou\'ve created in Arcus. Browse Support for FAQs, how-to articles,\nvideos and helpful tutorials like this one.
What lives in the Climate card? Home climate depends on more than just a\nthermostat. Manage and control thermostats, fans, vents and temperature-reading devices\nthroughout your home. Scheduling Schedules are managed under the Schedule\ntab. For thermostats, Arcus has created an\nenergy efficient schedule. You can choose to\nactivate or customize the schedule. Temperature Any device that can report temperature\nand humidity to Arcus will appear under\nthe Temperature tab. More Tap the MORE tab to select the\ntemperature and humidity that you\'d\nlike to see on your Dashboard.
Connect & Automate Devices Rules tell devices what to do\nwhen something happens. Rules are easy to create Add a rule by tapping the \'+\'\nsign on the dashboard. Rules are Easy to Customize Tap the underlined word\nto build the Rule. Rules Work When You\nWant Them To You can schedule Rules to be active\nat certain times of the day. All Your Rules in One Place Manage and edit existing Rules in the\nleft hand navigation.
Control Multiple Devices at Once Scenes get a lot done by linking devices\ntogether.\n\ni.e., the Good Night Scene can turn off lights, \nadjust the thermostat and lock your doors. Scenes Can be Triggered in \nMultiple Ways \n Scenes are Easy to Create Add a Scene by tapping the \'+\' on\nthe dashboard. All Your Scenes in One Place Manage and edit existing Scenes in the left\nhand navigation. Hooray! Your Hub was set up successfully. Name your device and add a photo if you like.
Choose ON when no one is home and you wish to secure your home. Partial is typically used when motion sensors are not participating, so you can move around the home at night without triggering the alarm. Choose OFF to disarm\nyour security system. Alarm Notification List To add a Person to your notification list, \n they must have a PIN code and a phone \n number. It is recommended to have \n two or more people on your list. Triggered Alarm A triggered alarm will tell you what\ndevice(s) triggered the alarm. Cancel\nthe alarm in the app or on your keypad\nusing your 4 digit PIN code. Panic Alarm Panic Alarm can be triggered from the\nkeypad or care pendant. \n\n Cancel panic alarms in the app or on the \n keypad using your 4 digit PIN code.
